alert.note: Alert for Nash; Wayne; Wilson (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 16 at 8:43AM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Wayne, central Nash, Edgecombe and Wilson Counties through 915 AM EDT... At 842 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm with heavy rain and excessive lightning over Elm City, or 8 miles south of Rocky Mount, moving south at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Rocky Mount, Tarboro, Nashville, Wilson, Elm City, Fremont, Dortches, Bailey, Red Oak and Princeville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This thunderstorm is producing an excessive amount of cloud to ground lightning. Seek shelter indoors and stay away from windows. If you cannot seek shelter indoors, an enclosed vehicle can provide safe shelter. Deadly lightning strikes can occur well ahead of an approaching storm, prior to the arrival of rain and wind.
